ygData.subject: Empty order.xml file when creating profiles and jobs in 1.14	and 1.12.1

From: "Gordon Paynter" <Gordon.Paynter@...>
Subject: Empty order.xml file when creating profiles and jobs in 1.14
	and 1.12.1
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=235746949

Hi all:

I have just installed version 1.14 (the first install I have done =
since 1.5!). I have found that when I create a new profile through the web =
UI, the order.xml file created is empty.  This carries over to jobs created=
 using that profile: they have an empty order.xml file too. Obviously, thes=
e jobs don't work. 

I have also tried Heritrix 1.12.1 and I see the same b=
ehaviour, so presumably the problem is at my end. I have listed the Alerts =
I get below. 


Here are a few more details:

When I create the profile in =
the web UI, I edit it and change the User-Agent and From header fields.  If=
 I go back and edit it again in the web UI, my changes are still there, eve=
n though the order.xml file in the profile directory is zero bytes. If I st=
op Heritrix and restart, my changes are gone in the web UI too (suggests th=
ese values are cached?). 

If I add seeds to the profile, the seeds.xml fil=
e is saved correctly in the profile directory (and used in any job) alongsi=
de the empty order.xml file.


Looking back in the mailing list, I see Sonj=
a Schaule reported the same problem on 12/12/07 but got no response.

Also =
looking back on the mailing list I think someone else (Eric Hetzner?) stati=
ng that the Java packaged with Ubuntu/Debian was "not worth bothering with"=
. Could this be the problem?  And why--a crazy Debian security measure?

TI=
A.
Gordon


When creating the profile I get alerts like this:
